definition: A Swedish pop group that made disco so cool even your grandma danced along.
A legendary hero who could be unstoppable if not for that pesky heel.
A paint so versatile, it sticks to your canvas, your clothes, and maybe your cat.
The art of flailing gracefully to music while pretending it's fun.
A spiky plant that sweetens your margarita and pokes you at the same time.
A grand opera so dramatic it might leave you singing your grocery list.
A curious girl, a grinning cat, and a tea party that'll make you question reality.
A nut that masquerades as milk, butter, and your new favorite snack.
A vocal range so smooth, it can lull a restless toddler to sleep—maybe.
A shade of pinkish-red that sounds like a fancy dessert but is actually just a hue.
A warm, golden hue that looks like sunshine got stuck in a traffic light.
A salty fish that sneaks onto your pizza and dares you to like it.
The goddess of love whose matchmaking skills rival every rom-com you’ve seen.
A fuzzy little fruit that can't decide if it's a peach or an orange.
A language so rich, it could write poetry just by clearing its throat.
An indie rock band that set out to prove your grandma was wrong about guitars.
A musical flourish that’s basically a fancy way to run up and down a scale.
A leaf so peppery it makes your lettuce weep with inferiority.
Nature’s neon lights, appearing only when you really can’t find your camera.
A fancy blue that pretends it's too cool for just being called 'sky blue.'
A Russian stringed instrument that makes you want to dance in a furry hat.
A fancy feast where forks multiply and you have no clue which to use first.
A herb so aromatic it might convince you you're an Italian chef.
A language so melodic it could sing lullabies to your stubborn alarm clock.
A clingy vine that just won't take no for an answer when hugging your garden.
When winter decides to throw a snow party and forgets to send an end time.
A repetitive orchestral piece that escalates from whisper to full-blown meltdown.
Beet soup so red it makes your bowl look like a crime scene.
A Renaissance painter who basically invented flowing hair and seashell selfies.
A friendly way of politely punching someone in the face for competitive fun.
A metal-inspired hue perfect for statues, tans, and third-place medals.
A ring-shaped cake that loves to show off its donut cousin's figure.
A shrub so fiery red, it might make your autumn jealous.
Fancy handwriting that makes your grocery list look like a royal decree.
Pizza’s introverted cousin, all tucked in and ready for munching.
A flower so refined, it might ask you to remove your shoes before watering.
Sugar’s sticky cousin that turns apples into treats and your teeth into glue.
A red so deep, it might just convert you to its fashion cult.
Animated drawings that teach us an anvil can drop from the sky without notice.
When you decide your arms and legs should swap places just for fun.
A spicy powder that sets your taste buds on fire faster than you can say 'ouch.'
An ancient tongue that could charm dragons or at least make bagpipes sound cooler.
A three-headed hound that never learned to fetch, but guards the underworld like a champ.
A fancy blue shade that might convince you to quit your job and live by the sea.
A spiced tea so cozy it hugs you from the inside out, then asks for cookies.
A braided bread so fluffy it can double as a fashion statement on the dinner table.
A moody gray that makes you think of campfires, sketch pads, and smudged fingers.
A leafy green that looks like spinach but has rainbow stems just to show off.
A rosy-cheeked baby angel that aims tiny arrows at you for Valentine's Day shenanigans.
A slender herb that keeps onions awake at night with its mild, fresh flavor.
A composer so poetic, your piano might cry tears of joy when you play his works.
Wispy clouds that dance in the sky while whispering, 'It might rain, but I'm not telling.'
A woodwind instrument that can squeak like a duck or serenade like a dream, depending on skill.
A three-leaf wonder that promises luck only if you find one with four.
Colorful pages where spandex-clad heroes and villains yell ‘Pow!’ and ‘Bam!’ for your delight.
A fancy dish that insists on stuffing cheese and ham into chicken, like a culinary matryoshka doll.
Breakfast cereal that wakes you up with a loud crunch and nostalgia for Saturday cartoons.
When the tune decides to get louder, gradually sneaking from polite hum to thunderous roar.
A bat-and-ball game known for polite clapping and matches that can last longer than your vacation.
A deep red that screams ‘Look at me!’ in a voice louder than a fire truck.
A swirling storm that spins faster than your washing machine on its angriest cycle.
A cheerful yellow bloom that pops up in spring to remind winter it’s time to leave.
A Scandinavian tongue that pairs brilliantly with pastries and cozy winter sweaters.
A style so glitzy it makes skyscrapers look like they're wearing sequined dresses.
A rock band whose Smoke on the Water riff might haunt your Guitar Hero dreams.
A divine being with more power than your Wi-Fi router on a good day.
Half mortal, half god, fully qualified to attend awkward family reunions on Olympus.
A West African drum that commands you to dance, even if you have two left feet.
A tree that shows off pastel blooms in spring, making your neighbors’ yard jealous.
In basketball, bouncing the ball without running away with it—like a well-trained dog.
A string instrument that tinkles with such sweetness, even fairies might take notes.
A doughy pocket of joy that proves any cuisine can be improved by stuffing it.
A sci-fi novel about giant worms, spice, and the best desert fashion statement ever.
A deep, dark black that thinks it’s cooler than just saying ‘black.’
The afterlife VIP lounge where heroes go to sip ambrosia and brag about their quests.
A language that loves borrowing words from others and never returning them.
A Japanese ballad style so passionate, it can make karaoke nights feel like epic drama.
Long, thin mushrooms that look like noodle wannabes but taste far more earthy.
A long story so grand, you might forget what real life is while reading.
A language family for icy lands, boasting more words for 'snow' than you thought possible.
A lively Spanish dance that dares you not to spin out of control.
An herb with a licorice taste so mild it won’t remind you of candy, promise.
A fiery Spanish style where guitars cry, feet stomp, and passion ignites the stage.
A plant that moonlights as linen, seeds, and a reason to question your diet choices.
A Dutch dialect that might trick you into thinking Belgium is all about waffles.

Tales passed down that explain everything from talking foxes to why socks vanish.
A flying disc that turns lazy afternoons into UFO sightings for dogs.

A magenta-like shade so loud, it might wake the neighbors at midnight.
A Celtic language that can make even mundane words sound like a mystical chant.
Spiritual tunes so uplifting, they could make your Monday morning shout ‘Hallelujah!’
An opaque paint that gives watercolor a facelift and your canvas a thick attitude.
A keyboard instrument that sounds like a guitar got stuck in a piano.
A warm brownish hue that eyes love to flaunt and nature loves to replicate.
A purple so flowery, it might just outshine the blossoms in your backyard.
The study of plants that insists on curing your ailments with leaves and magic.
A fast-paced game on ice where friendly brawls can break out at any time.
A sweet, sticky sauce that makes every stir-fry feel like a VIP guest.

A cackling carnivore that laughs at its own jokes and your survival plans.
A mountain goat with horns so fancy, it makes your hairstyle look dull.
The guy who flew too close to the sun, forgetting sunscreen and wax don’t mix.
A prehistoric tale of a squirrel, an acorn, and the ultimate patience test.
A frosty treat that solves heartbreak, celebrates birthdays, and makes your dentist rich.
A frozen spike of doom hanging from rooftops, just waiting to drop on unsuspecting heads.
A fictional film about winter’s deadliest decorations chasing clueless victims—chilling indeed.
Epic Greek poem of war, gods, and the famous heel that sparked a thousand battles.
Turning ideas into pictures, for people who prefer visuals over reading instructions.
A dream within a dream within a headache that leaves you spinning like a top.
A deep, moody blue that is too cool to just be ‘blue.’
A 3D artwork so large and confusing, it might eat your living room for breakfast.
A cosmic voyage that proves love can transcend dimensions, but your popcorn might not.
A digital home address for your device, minus the nosy neighbors and garden gnomes.
A vibrant flower so regal, it practically demands you address it as ‘Your Majesty.’
A billionaire in a metal suit who fights baddies and still finds time to crack jokes.
A romance language that makes even your grocery list sound like a love poem.
A pale hue fancy enough for pianos and wedding dresses—just don’t spill coffee on it.
The prized tusk material that puts elephants on every villain’s shopping list—unfortunately.
A tree that showers purple flowers like confetti, turning sidewalks into fairy-tale paths.
A canine trickster that laughs at your secrets while raiding the neighborhood trash.
A martial arts legend who does his own stunts and might out-parkour your dreams.
A spotted cat who thinks it’s the stealth boss of the rainforest—and it’s right.

A gothic novel of love, mystery, and an attic secret that might terrify your book club.
A polite language full of hidden levels of respect, like an onion with manners.
A programming language that runs on everything—from your toaster to your spaceship, probably.
A film about a giant shark that made everyone fear beaches—thanks Spielberg.
Improvised tunes so cool your toe-tapping might break the sound barrier.
A wiggly sea creature that’s half water balloon, half electric fence, and all confusion.
A massive serpent who thought wrapping around the Earth was the ultimate cuddle.
A gaming device that tests the limits of your thumbs and your patience.
A martial art where you politely flip someone onto the mat—just for fun.
A board game so lively, it unleashes jungle chaos on your living room—roll at your own risk.

A martial art that teaches you to punch boards and shout dramatically.
A skewer of grilled delight that proves anything can be improved with stick technology.
A letter jungle where your fingers roam in search of typos and accidental emojis.
A thousand bytes—enough memory to store your top-secret text file from the ‘90s.
A giant ape who scales skyscrapers like they’re playground slides—no bananas required.
A feline friend that plots world domination between naps and treat demands.
A warrior race from Star Trek with forehead ridges cooler than your wrinkles.
A eucalyptus-munching marsupial that looks cuddly but might judge your life choices.
A language that pairs perfectly with K-dramas, K-pop, and your next kimchi craving.
A South Korean pop phenomenon with catchy beats that conquer your playlist instantly.
A giant sea monster that terrorizes ships, proving nightmares can come in tentacle form.
A vine that grows so fast it might steal your car keys if parked too long.
A fantasy film with a goblin king so dazzling he almost outshines his own mullet.
A polka-dotted insect that brings luck—unless you’re a leaf it’s about to munch.
A portable computer that loves your lap but hates your battery life.
Layered pasta so comforting it could end family feuds—unless Garfield eats it first.
A focused beam of light that can cut steel, zap cats, or dazzle dance floors.
A dead language that refuses to die, whispering ‘Carpe diem’ from ancient textbooks.
A soothing purple hue that smells like grandma’s sachets and gentle dreams.
A spotted cat that hunts silently but announces fashion statements loudly.
A 19th-century novel so epic it can double as a doorstop—and then sing about it.
A Disney tale of royal felines and an uncle so shady Scar’s got permanent sunburn.
A printing technique that gives your stone slab a chance to become immortal art.
A reptile that sometimes abandons its tail faster than you can say 'ouch.'
A gritty superhero film proving even claws get old and cranky.
A mischievous trickster god who pranks for fun and occasionally breaks the universe.
A serene flower that blooms in murky water, making mud look like a day spa.
Sledding face-up at insane speeds, because normal sledding was too safe.
A gentle tune that tries to coax you into dreamland before your insomnia objects.
A parrot so colorful it makes rainbows question their life choices.
Teaching computers to learn, so they can outsmart us and take our snack breaks.
An animated zoo escape where dancing lemurs and a paranoid zebra steal the show.
A tree whose blossoms are so large they could host a tea party for fairies.
A prehistoric elephant with built-in fur coat and tusks designed for winter fashion.
A tonal language so intricate, your tongue might do backflips if it had feet.
A sweet, juicy fruit that drips summer vibes and sticky fingers.
A 26.2-mile jog that tests your will, your legs, and your playlist’s endurance.
A deep reddish-brown hue that can’t decide if it’s fancy red or super-serious purple.
A sci-fi flick that makes you question your reality—and your spoon collection.
A serpent-haired lady whose beauty routine involves petrifying anyone who dares stare.
A million bytes of data—enough space for memes, but not all your cat photos.

A silent film classic that invented futuristic cityscapes before we had flying cars.
A colossal whale tale proving revenge is best served with a side of sea salt.
Rainy season that turns streets into rivers and umbrellas into boats.
A massive deerlike creature that laughs in the face of your tiny car.
A giant painting on a wall that saves your wallpaper from being too boring.
One billionth of a second, or the exact time your alarm waits to ring again.
A ninja tale so full of ramen, you’ll crave noodles more than superpowers.
The unicorn of the sea, proving that even whales need fancy headgear.
A deep blue so serious, it commands ships and your wardrobe at the same time.
A cosmic cloud of dust or a code name for futuristic projects—take your pick.
A Greek goddess of retribution whose sole job is to ensure poetic justice happens.

Orwell’s classic that makes you eye your webcam suspiciously and question your dictionary.
Slurpy strands of joy that coil around your fork and your heart.

A yellowish-brown pigment that insists it’s more cultured than regular mud.

A pretty flower that politely warns: 'Admire me, but please don't nibble.'

An international sports fest where five rings mean unity, not marital status.
The end of the Greek alphabet—perfect for naming your final, unstoppable code project.

A fantasy road trip where elves, magic, and half a dad are the norm.

A great ape with serious arms and a knack for making trees their personal hammocks.

A sleek black cat prowling the jungle with a confidence that outstruts supermodels.
A bird that repeats your secrets and occasionally stages a coup against boredom.
A winged horse who probably hates airport security lines but loves flying over rainbows.
A flightless bird that waddles around Antarctica wearing a tux, no event required.
A gentle bluish-purple that sounds like a fairy-tale flower and looks like one too.
A boy who refuses to grow up, raising serious property tax issues in Neverland.
A light particle so fast, it leaves your shadow feeling out of shape.
A coniferous tree that keeps Christmas relevant and covers your carpet in needles.
An animation studio that makes you cry over toys and fish, and you love it anyway.
A saucy, cheesy circle that’s the solution to 99% of your hunger problems.
A film that asks the big question: what if primates ran the world better than us?
A purple shade so sweet, it might trick you into tasting wallpaper.
A Slavic language known for its consonant clusters that can tie your tongue in knots.
A horseback game that fuses golf, hockey, and a dash of wild equestrian chaos.
Catchy tunes so bubbly, they stick in your head longer than gum on a shoe.
A painting of a person who had to hold still longer than your phone camera demands.
A temperamental device that loves paper jams more than printing your final report.
A set of digital manners that computers follow more politely than humans ever could.
A four-sided shape used to remind you geometry class was an endless parade of angles.
A small bird that pretends its head feather is the latest fashion accessory.
A show or film about FBI recruits who juggle mysteries and shootouts with style.
When your computer decides it can be two places at once, blowing your mind.
A claustrophobic horror flick that makes staying at home way too real.
A speedy Marvel mutant who outruns bullets—and your desire to keep up with him.
A protein-packed pseudo-grain that tries to be rice but ends up fancier.
An epic that questions where you're going—probably somewhere with more popcorn.

A meteorological tantrum where thunder and lightning decide the skies need a mosh pit.

A woven wall-hanging that lets you decorate your castle like a medieval influencer.

Electronic beats so repetitive, they hypnotize you into dancing like a robot with soul.

A racket sport where grunting and fancy footwork unite to battle fuzzy yellow orbs.

An art medium so runny, it might just paint your table while you paint the paper.
